synoptic.algorithms.bisim
Class Bisimulation

java.lang.Object
  synoptic.algorithms.bisim.Bisimulation

public abstract class Bisimulation
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements the algorithm BisimH ( Bisimulation.splitPartitions), and a modified version of the algorithm kTail (Bisimulation.mergePartitions) that considers state labels instead of state transitions. It is based on the code from Clemens Hammacher's implementation of a partition refinement algorithm for bisimulation minimization. Source: https://ccs.hammacher.name License: Eclipse Public License v1.0.

Constant Field Values

incomingTransitionSplit

private static boolean incomingTransitionSplit
Consider incoming transitions for splitting TODO: expose this as a command line option

interleavedMerging

private static boolean interleavedMerging
Coarsen the representation after each successful split (i.e. each split that caused a previously unsatisfied invariant to become satisfied. This may or may not speed up operation.

Method Detail

tryAndRecordSplitOp

public static boolean tryAndRecordSplitOp(ITemporalInvariant inv,
                                          PartitionGraph pGraph,
                                          java.util.HashMap<Partition,PartitionMultiSplit> splitsToDoByPartition,
                                          Partition partitionBeingSplit,
                                          PartitionMultiSplit splitOp)
Attempts to perform the splitOp on the pGraph to see whether or not the resulting graph has no other counter-examples for the invariant inv (i.e. whether or not the graph satisfies inv).

Parameters:
inv - The invariant to check for satisfiability after the splitOp.
pGraph - The partition graph to apply to the splitOp to.
splitsToDoByPartition - The HashMap recording splits by partition -- will be updated if the split makes the graph satisfy the invariant.
partitionBeingSplit - The partition being split by splitOp.
splitOp - The split operation to apply to pGraph
Returns:
true if the split makes the graph satisfy the invariant, and false otherwise.

splitPartitions

public static void splitPartitions(PartitionGraph pGraph)
Splits the partitions in pGraph until all synoptic.invariants returned by pGraph.getInvariants() are satisfied.

Parameters:
pGraph - the partition graph to refine\split

getSplits

private static java.util.List<PartitionSplit> getSplits(RelationPath<Partition> counterexampleTrace,
                                                        PartitionGraph pGraph)
Compute possible splits to remove the path counterexampleTrace from pGraph. This is done by following the path in the original (event) graph and determining the point where the partition graph allows a transition it should not allow. The event graph is accessed via the events stored by the partitions.

Parameters:
counterexampleTrace - - the path to remove
pGraph - - the graph from which the path shall be removed
Returns:
a list of partition splits that remove relPath

getSplitGraph

public static PartitionGraph getSplitGraph(IGraph<LogEvent> graph,
                                           TemporalInvariantSet invariants)
Construct a partition graph from graph (by partitioning by label), calls splitPartitions on it, and returns the refined graph.

Parameters:
graph - the graph from which should be used as initial graph
Returns:
the refined graph

pGraph -

kReduce

public static void kReduce(PartitionGraph pGraph,
                           int k)
Wrapper to mergePartitions without invariant preservation.

Parameters:
pGraph - the graph to reduce (merge k-equivalent partitions)
k - parameter for equality

mergePartitions

private static void mergePartitions(PartitionGraph pGraph,
                                    TemporalInvariantSet invariants,
                                    int k)
Merge partitions if they are k equal, while maintaining synoptic.invariants

Parameters:
pGraph - the graph to coarsen
invariants - the invariants to maintain during merge, can be null
k - the k parameter for k-equality
